meanings.definition: A small lizard that can change color to blend in with its surroundings.
meanings.sent1: The chameleon crawled slowly on the tree trunk, its skin matching the bark perfectly.
meanings.sent2: I spotted a chameleon in the garden, camouflaged among the leaves.
meanings.sent3: The chameleon decided to play hide-and-seek with the other lizards, but no one could find it!
meanings.sent4: Her ability to adapt to any situation made her a social chameleon in the office.
meanings.sent5: The chameleon's color-changing skill is like having a superpower in the animal kingdom.

meanings.definition: A person who changes their opinions or behavior easily.
meanings.sent1: He was a chameleon in the debate, switching sides whenever it suited him.
meanings.sent2: She's a real chameleon when it comes to fashion, always trying new styles.
meanings.sent3: The politician was called a chameleon for his ever-changing promises.
meanings.sent4: In the world of acting, being a chameleon is a valuable skill.
meanings.sent5: Her boss described her as a chameleon for her ability to adapt to any role in the company.
